title: Gravitational Wave Tails from Soft Theorem: A Short Review
abstract:
If a set of massive objects collide in space and the fragments disperse,
possibly forming black holes, then this process will emit gravitational waves.
Computing the detailed gravitational wave-form associated with this process is
a complicated problem, not only due to the non-linearity of gravity but also
due to the fact that during the collision and subsequent fragmentation the
objects could undergo complicated non-gravitational interactions. Nevertheless
the classical soft graviton theorem determines the power law fall-off of the
wave-form at late and early times, including logarithmic corrections, in terms
of only the momenta of the incoming and outgoing objects without any reference
to what transpired during the collision. In this short review I shall explain
the results and very briefly outline the derivation of these results.
